sentences.text: Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
Failed to read PIN: Not supported
Failed to create PKCS #15 meta structure: Generic PKCS#15 initialization error
pcscd[10929]: 00000000 dyn_unix.c:81:DYN_GetAddress() IFDHCreateChannelByName: /usr/lib/pcsc/drivers/openct-ifd.bundle/Contents/Linux/openct-ifd.so: undefined symbol: IFDHCreateChann
The symbol in openct-ifd.so is named IFDHCreateChannel (note the missing el) so this might be the cause for the above error.
Versions of packages pcscd depends on:
>      Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
>      Failed to read PIN: Not supported
>      Failed to create PKCS #15 meta structure: Generic PKCS#15 initialization error
>      pcscd[10929]: 00000000 dyn_unix.c:81:DYN_GetAddress() IFDHCreateChannelByName: /usr/lib/pcsc/drivers/openct-ifd.bundle/Contents/Linux/openct-ifd.so: undefined symbol: IFDHCreateChann
> The symbol in openct-ifd.so is named IFDHCreateChannel (note the missing > el) so this might be the cause for the above error.
I guess the log line has just been cut.
It is a warning from pcscd, not  the source of your problem.
Your reader "Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00" is correctly detected by pcscd.
Maybe your smart card is not supported by OpenSC?
On Sun, Dec 18, 2011 at 04:42:10PM +0100, Ludovic Rousseau wrote:
> >     Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
> >     Failed to read PIN: Not supported
> >     Failed to create PKCS #15 meta structure: Generic PKCS#15 initialization error
> >     pcscd[10929]: 00000000 dyn_unix.c:81:DYN_GetAddress() IFDHCreateChannelByName: /usr/lib/pcsc/drivers/openct-ifd.bundle/Contents/Linux/openct-ifd.so: undefined symbol: IFDHCreateChann
> >The symbol in openct-ifd.so is named IFDHCreateChannel (note the missing > >el) so this might be the cause for the above error.
> I guess the log line has just been cut.
It is a warning from pcscd, > not the source of your problem.
> Your reader "Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00" is correctly detected by
> Maybe your smart card is not supported by OpenSC?
The card is (or at least was) supported.
I have done this successfuly using lenny[1] and opensc-tool at least gives the correct output:
Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
pcscd[11757]: Error: Bad CTBCS APDU, ins=0x15
in the logs with the above commands.
On Sun, Dec 18, 2011 at 06:27:56PM +0100, Guido Gnther wrote:
> On Sun, Dec 18, 2011 at 04:42:10PM +0100, Ludovic Rousseau wrote:
> > >     Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
> > >     Failed to read PIN: Not supported
> > >     Failed to create PKCS #15 meta structure: Generic PKCS#15 initialization error
> > >     pcscd[10929]: 00000000 dyn_unix.c:81:DYN_GetAddress() IFDHCreateChannelByName: /usr/lib/pcsc/drivers/openct-ifd.bundle/Contents/Linux/openct-ifd.so: undefined symbol: IFDHCreateChann
> > >The symbol in openct-ifd.so is named IFDHCreateChannel (note the missing
> > >el) so this might be the cause for the above error.
> > I guess the log line has just been cut.
It is a warning from pcscd, > > not the source of your problem.
> > Your reader "Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00" is correctly detected by
> > Maybe your smart card is not supported by OpenSC?
The card is (or at least was) supported.
> I have done this successfuly using lenny[1] and opensc-tool at least > gives the correct output:
> Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
> Using reader with a card: Aladdin eToken PRO 00 00
> pcscd[11757]: Error: Bad CTBCS APDU, ins=0x15
> in the logs with the above commands.
since it also affects Aladdin Pro tokens.
